[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Consensus.AEDPoS/AEDPoSContract_ViewMethods.cs] [Function: IsMainChainMinerListChanged()] [Hash Collision] Lines 352-353 compare miner list hashes. Can attacker find hash collision to make different miner lists appear identical, bypassing change detection? (Critical)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Consensus.AEDPoS/AEDPoSContract_ViewMethods.cs] [Function: IsMainChainMinerListChanged()] [Empty List Check] Line 351 checks if MainChainCurrentMinerList.Pubkeys.Any(). If empty list passes this check, does hash comparison work correctly, or cause false positives? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Consensus.AEDPoS/AEDPoSContract_ViewMethods.cs] [Function: IsMainChainMinerListChanged()] [ToHex Conversion] Line 353 uses ToHex() on ByteString pubkeys. Can inconsistent encoding between current round and main chain list cause false change detection? (Low)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Consensus.AEDPoS/AEDPoSContract_ViewMethods.cs] [Function: GetMinerListHash()] [Order Dependency] Line 359 uses OrderBy to sort before hashing. Can attacker provide unsorted duplicate lists that hash differently, causing inconsistent change detection? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Consensus.AEDPoS/AEDPoSContract_ViewMethods.cs] [Function: GetMinerListHash()] [String Concatenation] Line 359 uses Aggregate with string concatenation. Can very long miner lists cause performance issues or memory exhaustion during hashing? (Low)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Consensus.AEDPoS/AEDPoSContract_ViewMethods.cs] [Function: GetMinerListHash()] [Empty String Seed] Line 359 starts with empty string seed. Does this correctly handle edge case of empty miner list, or produce collision with single-character pubkey? (Low)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Consensus.AEDPoS/AEDPoSContract_ViewMethods.cs] [Function: UpdateCandidateInformation()] [IsMainChain Guard] Line 370 returns early if not main chain. Can side chain bypass this by setting IsMainChain flag, allowing it to manipulate Election contract? (Critical)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Consensus.AEDPoS/AEDPoSContract_ViewMethods.cs] [Function: UpdateCandidateInformation()] [External Call Failure] Lines 372-378 call ElectionContract.UpdateCandidateInformation. [File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Consensus.AEDPoS/AEDPoSContract_ViewMethods.cs] [Function: UpdateCandidateInformation()] [IsEvilNode Flag] Line 377 sets IsEvilNode flag. Can attacker manipulating isEvilNode parameter mark legitimate miners as evil to force their removal? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Consensus.AEDPoS/AEDPoSContract_ViewMethods.cs] [Function: UpdateCandidateInformation()] [Negative Stats] Lines 375-376 pass recentlyProducedBlocks and recentlyMissedTimeSlots. Can negative values corrupt Election contract's candidate ranking? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Consensus.AEDPoS/AEDPoSContract_ViewMethods.cs] [Function: GetMinersCount()] [Null Timestamp Return] Line 383 returns SupposedMinersCount if BlockchainStartTimestamp is null. Can attacker exploit uninitialized state to lock miner count at initial value? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Consensus.AEDPoS/AEDPoSContract_ViewMethods.cs] [Function: GetMinersCount()] [Round 1 Check] Line 385 checks if round 1 exists and returns 0 if not. Can this cause consensus deadlock if genesis round is missing from state? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Consensus.AEDPoS/AEDPoSContract_ViewMethods.cs] [Function: GetMinersCount()] [Integer Overflow] Lines 386-390 perform multiple arithmetic operations (Add, Div, Mul). [File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Consensus.AEDPoS/AEDPoSContract_ViewMethods.cs] [Function: GetMinersCount()] [Time-based Increase] Lines 389-390 calculate miner increase based on blockchain age. Can attacker manipulating timestamps accelerate miner count growth beyond intended rate? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Consensus.AEDPoS/AEDPoSContract_ViewMethods.cs] [Function: GetMinersCount()] [MinerIncreaseInterval Division] Line 390 divides by MinerIncreaseInterval. If this is 0 or very small, can it cause division by zero or excessive miner count? (Critical)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Consensus.AEDPoS/AEDPoSContract_ViewMethods.cs] [Function: GetMinersCount()] [Mul(2) Justification] Line 390 multiplies by 2. Is this hardcoded multiplier safe, or can it cause miner count to grow faster than network can handle? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Consensus.AEDPoS/AEDPoSContract_ViewMethods.cs] [Function: GetMinersCount()] [MaximumMinersCount Cap] Line 390 uses Math.Min with MaximumMinersCount. Can attacker set MaximumMinersCount to very low value to prevent network growth? (Medium)
